sen.j: 安倍 季巌（あべ すえよし、1904年5月6日 - 1986年3月18日）は、雅楽師、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: Sueyoshi ABE (May 6, 1904 to March 18, 1986) was a gagakushi (court musician) and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Sueyoshi ABE (May 6, 1904 to March 18, 1986) was a gagakushi (court musician) and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
Sueyoshi ABE (May 6, 1904 to March 18, 1986) was a gagakushi (court musician) and a member of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 孝昭天皇の子孫と伝えられる古代以来の宮廷雅楽師の家に生まれる。
sen.e: Born in an ancient-time originated family of a Kyutei gagakushi (old Japanese court musician) who is said to be a descendant of Emperor Kosho.
He was born in an ancient-time originated family of a Kyutei gagakushi (old Japanese court musician), who is said to be a descendant of Emperor Kosho.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすいように書き換えました。
sen.e: He was born in an ancient-time originated family of a Kyutei gagakushi (old Japanese court musician), who is said to be a descendant of Emperor Kosho.

sen.j: 実父は基巌、早世した本家安倍季朝の後を継ぐ。
sen.e: His father was Motomine, succeeding Suetomo ABE of his head family who had died early.
His father was Motomine, who succeeded the head family Suetomo ABE, who had died early.
sen.cmt: より原文の意味に近くなるように訳を変えました。
sen.e: His father was Motomine, who succeeded the head family Suetomo ABE, who had died early.
Born in Tokyo.
He was born in Tokyo.
He was born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 1921年宮内省雅楽練習所卒、宮内省式部職楽部楽師。
sen.e: In 1921 he graduated from GagakuTraining Center, Imperial Household Ministry, and became a gakushi (musician) of Gakubu section, Shikibu-shoku, Imperial Household Ministry.
In 1921, he graduated from GagakuTraining Center, Imperial Household Ministry, and became a gakushi (musician) of Gakubu section, Shikibu-shoku, Imperial Household Ministry.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1921, he graduated from GagakuTraining Center, Imperial Household Ministry, and became a gakushi (musician) of Gakubu section, Shikibu-shoku, Imperial Household Ministry.
In 1928 he was awarded a Dairai Kinen Sho (commemorative medal for the Emperor's accession to the imperial throne).
In 1928, he was awarded a Dairai Kinen Sho (commemorative medal for the Emperor's accession to the imperial throne).
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1928, he was awarded a Dairai Kinen Sho (commemorative medal for the Emperor's accession to the imperial throne).
In 1935 he was awarded a Manchukuo Emperor's Kinen Sho.
In 1935, he was awarded a Manchukuo Emperor's Kinen Sho.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1935, he was awarded a Manchukuo Emperor's Kinen Sho.
In 1936 he was awarded Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).
In 1936, he was awarded Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1936, he was awarded Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).
In 1939 he was awarded a Kun hachito (eighth grade) Order of the Sacred Treasure.
In 1939, he was awarded a Kun hachito (eighth grade) Order of the Sacred Treasure.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1939, he was awarded a Kun hachito (eighth grade) Order of the Sacred Treasure.

sen.j: 1941年正七位、神宮神部署雅楽講習所講師、紀元二千六百年記念章受章。
sen.e: In 1941 he was awarded Shoshichii (Senior Seventh rank), became an instructor of Gagaku Learning Center, Kanbesho, Jingu shrine, and was awarded Year 2600 Commemorative Medal.
In 1941, he was awarded Shoshichii (Senior Seventh rank), became an instructor of Gagaku Learning Center, Kanbesho, Jingu shrine, and was awarded Year 2600 Commemorative Medal.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1941, he was awarded Shoshichii (Senior Seventh rank), became an instructor of Gagaku Learning Center, Kanbesho, Jingu shrine, and was awarded Year 2600 Commemorative Medal.
In 1945 he was awarded a Kun nanato (seventh grade) Order of the Sacred Treasure.
In 1945, he was awarded a Kun nanato (seventh grade) Order of the Sacred Treasure.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1945, he was awarded a Kun nanato (seventh grade) Order of the Sacred Treasure.
In 1947 he became a gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills) of Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency).
In 1947, he became a gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills) of Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1947, he became a gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills) of Kunaifu (Imperial Household Agency).
In 1949 he became a gikan of General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet (Gafu Shikibu-shoku).
In 1949, he became a gikan of General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet (Gafu Shikibu-shoku).
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1949, he became a gikan of General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet (Gafu Shikibu-shoku).
In 1954 he became the Music Master of Shikibu-shoku Gakubu (Music Department) of Imperial Household Agency.
In 1954, he became the Music Master of Shikibu-shoku Gakubu (Music Department) of Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1954, he became the Music Master of Shikibu-shoku Gakubu (Music Department) of Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 1955年芸術選奨文部大臣賞受賞。
sen.e: In 1955 he was awarded a Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.
In 1955, he was awarded a Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1955, he was awarded a Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts.
In 1962 he was awarded an Award of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1962, he was awarded an Award of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1962, he was awarded an Award of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1969 he became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1969, he became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1969, he became a member of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1974 he was awarded a Kun santo (the third grade) Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
In 1974, he was awarded a Kun santo (the third grade) Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1974, he was awarded a Kun santo (the third grade) Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
His son is Suemasa ABE, a gakushi (musician).
